intro: Mariscus chrysocephalus, commonly known as the golden-headed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Mariscus chrysocephalus is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant color and unique appearance.
